definition: Jurchen, a Tungus ethnic group, predecessor of the Manchu ethnic group who founded the Later Jin Dynasty 後金|后金[Hou4 Jin1] and Qing Dynasty
archaic variant of 汝[ru3]
female/woman/daughter
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine
Jurchen language

sentences.english: National tradition is an important fact on the foundation of Nvzhen's country in King dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 民族传统是金代女真人得以立国的重要因素。

sentences.english: Jurchens were probably very strong in the early years of 12th century.
sentences.chinese: 女真人在12世纪早期可能是强大的。

sentences.english: Jin Dynasty was established by the tribe Nvzhen a unified multi-ethnic regime.
sentences.chinese: 金王朝是由女真族建立的一个统一的多民族政权。

sentences.english: The Jin literature created by Nuzhen nationalities was a multiple national one.
sentences.chinese: 女真族所建政权下的金朝文学具有多民族特征。

definition: Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
